Package model

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
model.Matrix
public class Matrix extends Object
Class that contains all the information about the matrix dimensions and the data
Version:
2.0
Author:
Bartek

  • Constructor Details

    • Matrix

      public Matrix(String numberOfColumns, String numberOfRows) throws MatrixDimensionException
      Matrix custom constructor
      Parameters:
      numberOfColumns - Non-negative integer, not greater than 5
      numberOfRows - Non-negative integer, not greater than 5
      Throws:
      MatrixDimensionException - Thrown if input parameters are absent or not parsable

    • Matrix

      Matrix custom constructor for Integer values Class designed for MatrixService and should only be used there Should only be used with correct values
      Parameters:
      numberOfColumns - Integer value
      numberOfRows - Integer value

  • Method Details

      Method for filling the matrix with null values. Necessary for set and get functions of the collection.

    • setMatrixValueAtPos

      public void setMatrixValueAtPos(int x, int y, String value) throws MatrixParseException
      Methode used to set a value at a selected position in a matrix
      Parameters:
      x - Position along the columns
      y - Position along the rows
      value - A floating point value represented as a string
      Throws:
      MatrixParseException - Thrown if the value is not parsable or empty

    • setMatrixValueAtPos

      public void setMatrixValueAtPos(int x, int y, Double value)
      Methode used to set a value at a selected position in the matrix Class designed for MatrixService and should only be used there Should only be used with correct values
      Parameters:
      x - Position along the columns
      y - Positions along the rows
      value - Value to set

    • getMatrixValueAtPos

      public Double getMatrixValueAtPos(int x, int y)
      Methode used to obtain the value at a selected position from the matrix Class designed for MatrixService and should only be used there Should only be used with correct values
      Parameters:
      x - Position along the columns
      y - Position along the rows
      Returns:
      Value at the position
